meanings.sent1: She skelpit the ball with her hand.
meanings.sent2: He skelpit the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The chef skelpit the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The wind skelpit the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The teacher skelpit the ruler on the desk to quiet the class.

meanings.definition: Having been struck or slapped forcefully.
meanings.sent1: Her skelpit arm was sore from the fall.
meanings.sent2: The skelpit door showed signs of a break-in.
meanings.sent3: The skelpit pillow felt lumpy and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The skelpit wall had cracks from the impact.
meanings.sent5: The skelpit tree branch hung low after the storm.
